messages.content: You are an AI annotator for NLP tasks related to climate-change. You will be provided with the description of a tasks. Please follow the instructions.

You are a text classifier. Your task is to label the provided input based on the criteria outlined below.

Task: Determine if the provided product review contains terms or concepts relevant to environmental sustainability.

Labels and Definitions:

- [Relevant]: Use this label if the review mentions aspects related to environmental sustainability, including but not limited to:
Explicit mentions: eco-friendly materials, recycling, energy efficiency, carbon footprint reduction, organic ingredients, biodegradable packaging, renewable resources, etc. 
Implicit mentions: natural or minimal ingredients, chemical-free formulations, product longevity and durability, minimal or recyclable packaging, refillable containers, concerns about harmful chemicals, preference for natural products, reducing waste, etc.

- [Not relevant]: Use this label if the review does not mention any aspects related to environmental sustainability.

Instructions:
Consider both explicit and implicit references to environmental sustainability.
Look for terms, phrases, or concerns that indicate a focus on the environment, even if not directly stated.
Assess the broader context of the review to determine if the product features or user experiences relate to sustainability.

Formatting: Your answer should be formatted in this way to ensure consistency:
```
Explanation: [Provide a brief, clear explanation justifying the label chosen]
Label: [Insert Label]
```

Example of well-formatted answer:
```
Explanation: The review mentions that the product is made from recycled materials and is energy efficient.
Label: [Relevant]
```

Input text: does not function as advertised, designed or soldprovides no oven cleaning functionality not after 60 seconds, not after 60 minutes, not after 60 hours. additionally it is a bad value, the oz to $dollar ratio 8. 0 to $10 which is both exorbitantly and prohibitively expensive. especially when it does not work at all. so it's a literal waste of money and time and energy. i'm an honest reviewer regardless, i strive to be fair and balanced and promote integrity and honestyof whether the producer or seller of a product is honest. but wait there's an upside the spray bottle that comes with it is is very nice and pretend dollars is is a very overpriced spray bottle but it's a very quality functioning spray bottle, i like it alot. but this review isn't about spray bottles is it it's about the efficacy of said oven cleaner and this is not one please please move on there's nothing to see here people please move on nothing to see here.

Input text: i swapped to a mooncup (which are great) but had to use pads after having a cervical procedure (go for your smears ladies!). these are great. i don't have anything else to reference though so i might just be happy with reusable pads in general. i like the idea that the inner lining is dark. they don't seem to stain and i run heavy. the larger pads will definitely keep during the night. obviously these don't absorb like disposable pads do so you'll come face to face with your clots and have to rinse them properly before washing (i rinse in the bath with cold water then use ecover detergent in the machine). depending on the type of underwear i'm wearing they can sometimes turn themselves around and i'll have to keep readjusting myself but that can be alleviated by wearing different pants. overall they're worth the purchase. for the planet and for your own health - why we think putting plastic and chemicals on our delicate regions isn't toxic to us i don't know!make the change : )

Input text: this duvet insert (or as my husband calls it, 'comforter' and my kids call it, 'blanket') is very fluffy, lightweight, and soft. right out of the package it was very thin because it's vacuum sealed in plastic... but i always wash fabric items before using them to get any loose chemicals off like extra flame retardant or anti-mold spray... whatever might be on there that i don't want on my skin. a wash and dry with fabric softener and it came out super fluffy and cozy. i'm not sure about durability yet but it appears well made and i'm really pleased with it so far, especially for the price! also, i like that the tabs for tying the duvet cover on are nice and wide so it doesn't take super nimble fingers to thread it through a tiny loop. i'm using this for my airbnb so will come back to update on how well it holds up through many many washes with bleach and very hot water.
